commitResults.messageBody: There are several methods to display the greeting exit messages. I have decided to store the greetings message and exit message as separate strings "header" and "ending". This improves the formatting of the code and makes future edits easier.
Create a UserInputHandler class that will handle the logic for reading user input and generating appropriate responses.

UserInputHandler uses Scanner object from java.util to communicate with user. Scanner object is initialised when UserInputHandler() constructor is called.

UserInputHandler logic has two basic methods getInput() and handleInput() to receive input from the user and to handle the input from the user.

Friday creates UserInputHandler object to handle user input when Friday is being used.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add BotMessage class, added BotMessage to Friday logic and added basic chatting logic
commitResults.messageBody: Used BotMessage class to encapsulate a bot response from Friday. Created a method start() in Friday to start a chat with a user. The chat ends only when the user inputs the String "bye". This is the intended behaviour of Level 1.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add basic list functionality to chatbot
commitResults.messageBody: Add ArrayList field to Friday which will store the inputs of the user. Add printlist() method to Friday which handles the logic for generating the string responsible for displaying the stored user inputs when user prompts the bot with "list". Adjusted start() logic to handle the prompt "list". Added additional String formatting to handleInput() in UserInputHandler.java.

Task class encapsulates the user input by storing the task description and an additional boolean field to determine the status of the Task. Add markAsDone() and markAsUndone() methods to change the isDone state. Change ArrayList in Friday to store Task objects instead. Add mark and unmark user input logic to start() in Friday.
Add Todo class. Testing SourceTree push changes.
Add Deadline and Event classes. Testing Git settings again.
Deadline, Event and Todo classes inherit from Task class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify start() logic to work with new Task subclasses and improved bot response
commitResults.messageBody: Use indexOf() and substring() methods to extract text from user input assuming that the user gives Friday an appropriate response. Use trim() to remove any additional whitespaces after the input description. This streamlines editing for the bot response.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify runtest.sh to work with Friday
commitResults.messageBody: Changed file destinations to use runtest.sh script. Additionally, added spacings and "\t" tab spaces to beautify Friday's messages.

commitResults.messageTitle: Exception handling for Todo and Incorrect input
commitResults.messageBody: Add exception handling for Todo and incorrect inputs. Will add exception tests to scripts.sh and also add more exception handling to reach typical and stretch goals level.

Added delete command which deletes an entry according to the index of the Task in the list. For future reference, add exception handling for when trying to remove an item which is out of bounds of the array length (1, list.size()).
